	ITEM&nbsp;4.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	INFORMATION ON THE COMPANY
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	A.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D172754D20F_HTM_TOC172754_12">
</A>
	History and Development of the Company
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We were established as a joint stock limited company under the
	Company Law of the PRC on March&nbsp;6, 1996, and have conducted our business for twenty&nbsp;years.&nbsp;Our legal name is
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/27/0001193125-16-557513_G172754G68T21.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
	, and its English translation is Guangshen Railway Company Limited. Our registered office is located at No.&nbsp;1052 Heping Road, Shenzhen, Guangdong Province, The People&#146;s Republic of China, 518010. Our telephone
	number is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(86-755)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2558-8150
</FONT>
	and our fax number is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(86-755)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2559-1480.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In May&nbsp;1996, our H&nbsp;shares (stock code:&nbsp;00525) were listed on the HKSE and our American Depositary Shares, or ADSs (ticker
	symbol:&nbsp;GSH), were listed on the NYSE.&nbsp;Our A shares (stock code:&nbsp;601333) were listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange in December&nbsp;2006.&nbsp;We are currently the only PRC railway enterprise with shares concurrently listed in
	Shanghai, Hong Kong and New York.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We are mainly engaged in passenger and freight transportation businesses on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	the&nbsp;Shenzhen-Guangzhou-Pingshi
</FONT>
</FONT>
	Railway, which is 481.2 kilometers long, running vertically through Guangdong Province.&nbsp;The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Pingshi
</FONT>
	Railway is the southern part of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing-Guangzhou
</FONT>
	Railway, which connects Northern China with Southern China.&nbsp;The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Shenzhen
</FONT>
	Railway is strategically located and links with major railway networks in China, including the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing-Guangzhou,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing-Kowloon,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Sanshui-Maoming,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pinghu-Nantou,
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pinghu-Yantian
</FONT>
	lines, as well as to
	the Kowloon Canton Railway in Hong Kong, which is an important component of the transportation network of southern China, as well as the only railway channel linking Hong Kong with Mainland China.&nbsp;The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Shenzhen
</FONT>
	Railway is currently one of the most modern railways in the PRC as well as the first wholly fenced railway with four parallel lines in the PRC that allows passenger trains and freight trains
	to run on separate lines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	16
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D172754D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Passenger transportation is our principal business.&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we
	operated 239&nbsp;pairs of passenger trains each&nbsp;day, including 105 pairs of intercity high-speed passenger trains between Guangzhou and Shenzhen (including 19
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	stand-by
</FONT>
	pairs), 13&nbsp;pairs of Hong Kong
	Through Trains (including 11&nbsp;pairs of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Canton-Kowloon
</FONT>
	Through Trains, 1&nbsp;pair of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Zhaoqing-Kowloon
</FONT>
	Through Trains and 1&nbsp;pair of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing/Shanghai-Kowloon
</FONT>
	Through Trains) and 121 pairs of long-distance trains. We have adopted an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#147;As-Frequent-As-Buses&#148;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
	operating model by dispatching one pair of our domestically manufactured electric multiple units
	trains, known as &#147;China Railway
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	High-Speed
</FONT>
	trains&#148; or &#147;CRHs,&#148; every 10 minutes on average during peak hours between Guangzhou and Shenzhen. The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	through-trains
</FONT>
	passing Hong Kong jointly operated by us and the MTR Corporation Limited (&#147;MTR&#148;) are one of the most important means of transportation between Guangzhou and Hong Kong. We have
	organized and operated a number of long-distance trains running from and to Guangzhou and Shenzhen that linked with most of the provinces, autonomous regions and municipals across the nation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Freight transportation is another important segment of our business.&nbsp;We are
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	well-equipped
</FONT>
	with comprehensive freight facilities and are able to efficiently transport full load cargo, single load cargo, containers, bulky and overweight cargo, dangerous cargo, fresh and live cargo, and oversized cargo.&nbsp;Our rail lines operated are
	closely knitted with the major ports in Guangzhou and Shenzhen and are connected to several large industrial zones, logistics zones and plants and mines in the Pearl River Delta region via the railroad sidings. The major market of our freight
	transportation business is domestic mid-to long-distance transportation, and we enjoy competitive advantages in domestic mid-to long-distance freight transportation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We have extended our passenger and freight transportation business to include railway operation services with the commencement of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Wuhan-Guangzhou
</FONT>
	Passenger Railway
	Line in December&nbsp;2009. As of the date of this annual report, we have provided such services to Wuhan-Guangzhou Passenger Railway Line Co., Ltd., Guangdong Guangzhou&#150;Zhuhai
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Inter-city
</FONT>
	Railway Traffic
	Co., Ltd.,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong
</FONT>
	Kong Express Rail Link Company Limited,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Zhuhai
</FONT>
	Railway Company Limited, Xiamen-Shenzhen Railway (Guangdong) Company Limited,
	Ganzhou-Shaoguan Railway Company Limited, Nanning-Guangzhou Railway Company Limited, and Guiyang-Guangzhou Railway Company Limited. With the successful completion and commencement of operation of a series of high-speed railways and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	inter-city
</FONT>
	railways in the &#147;Pan Pearl River Delta,&#148; our geographical coverage of railway operation service will be more extensive. We also intend to grow our business through railway operation services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Background, Restructuring and Acquisition
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The railroad system between Guangzhou and Shenzhen was part of the original
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#147;Canton-Kowloon&#148;
</FONT>
	railroad, which began operations in 1911. In 1949, following
	the establishment of the PRC, the railroad was divided into two sections, with the first linking Guangzhou and Shenzhen, and the second, across the Hong Kong border and separately owned, linking Luohu and the Kowloon peninsula in Hong Kong. The
	Guangzhou to Shenzhen railroad has been operated since 1949 by a sub-division of the Guangzhou Railway Bureau, a predecessor to GRGC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 1979, Guangshen Railway Company, our predecessor, in conjunction with Kowloon&#150;Canton Railway (&#147;KCR&#148;), which has been merged into the MTR, was engaged in the joint operation of Hong Kong
	Through Train passenger services between Guangzhou and Hong Kong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 1984, to exploit the rapid growth in the Pearl River
	Delta, Guangshen Railway Company, our predecessor, was established pursuant to the approval of the State Council as a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	state-owned
</FONT>
	enterprise administered by the Guangzhou Railway Bureau. At that time,
	Guangshen Railway Company had only a single-line railroad.&nbsp;Since then, large capital expenditures have been made to expand and upgrade its facilities and services.&nbsp;In 1987, construction of the second line was completed.&nbsp;In 1991,
	Guangshen Railway Company began the construction of a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	semi-high-speed
</FONT>
	rail line and purchased locomotives and passenger coaches, which can provide passenger train services at speeds of more than 160 kilometers
	per hour.&nbsp;Commercial operation of the electric multiple units (&#147;EMUs&#148;) commenced in December&nbsp;1994.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	17
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D172754D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We were established as a joint stock limited company on March&nbsp;6, 1996 following the
	Restructuring, which was carried out to reorganize the railroad assets and related businesses of Guangshen Railway Company and certain of its subsidiaries.&nbsp;As part of the Restructuring, 2,904,250,000 state legal person shares, par value RMB1.00
	per share, of our Company were issued to GRGC, a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	state-owned
</FONT>
	enterprise controlled by the MOR.&nbsp;Guangshen Railway Company retained the assets, liabilities and businesses not assumed by us, including units
	providing staff quarters and social services such as health care, education, public security and other ancillary services, as well as subsidiaries or joint ventures whose businesses do not relate to railroad operations and do not compete with our
	businesses.&nbsp;As part of our Restructuring, Guangshen Railway Company was renamed Guangzhou Railway (Group) Guangshen Railway Enterprise Development Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Since April&nbsp;1, 1996, we have been able to set our own prices for our EMU train services and charge a premium over average national prices for our other passenger and freight train services. See
	&#147;ITEM&nbsp;4. INFORMATION ON THE COMPANY&#151;B. Business Overview&#151;Regulatory Overview&#151;Pricing&#148; for a more detailed description of our pricing scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We completed our initial public offering of class H ordinary shares, or H&nbsp;shares, and our American depositary shares, or ADSs, in May&nbsp;1996.&nbsp;In that offering, we issued a total of
	1,431,300,000 H&nbsp;shares, par value RMB1.00 per share.&nbsp;Our H&nbsp;shares are listed for trading on the HKSE and our American depositary shares, or ADSs, each representing 50 H&nbsp;shares, are listed for trading on the NYSE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On November&nbsp;15, 2004, we entered into an asset purchase agreement with Yangcheng Railway Company to acquire the railway
	transportation business between Guangzhou and Pingshi and related assets and liabilities, or the Acquisition.&nbsp;In order to finance such Acquisition, on December&nbsp;13, 2006, we issued 2,747,987,000 A shares that are now listed for trading on
	the Shanghai Stock Exchange (stock code:&nbsp;601333) and raised approximately RMB10.0 billion from the A Share Offering.&nbsp;After the A Share Offering, approximately 41% of our issued and outstanding shares were owned by GRGC, while institutional
	and public shareholders own approximately 59% of our issued and outstanding ordinary shares, including A shares, H&nbsp;shares and ADSs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On December&nbsp;28, 2006, we paid RMB5.27 billion out of the proceeds raised from the A Share Offering to Yangcheng Railway Company.&nbsp;On January&nbsp;1, 2007, the railway transportation business of
	the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Pingshi
</FONT>
	Railway came under our control as a result of the Acquisition.&nbsp;As a result, our operations expanded from a regional railway to a national trunk line network and our operating railway
	distance extended from 152 kilometers to 481.2 kilometers, running vertically through the entire Guangdong Province.&nbsp;In June&nbsp;2007, we paid the remaining balance in the amount of RMB4.87 billion to Yangcheng Railway Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In April&nbsp;2010, in order to further reduce our administrative expenses and improve the overall efficiency of our administration
	system, we made efforts to optimize our internal management structure, including establishing the General Administrative Department, the Human Resources Department, the Planning and Finance Department, the Operation Management Department and the
	Audit Department, each of which is under the supervision of our general manager, and outsourcing all other administrative functions to external service providers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On November&nbsp;30, 2013, we entered into an agreement to acquire the freight service business and related assets of China Railway Express Co., Ltd. Guangzhou Branch (&#147;CREC&#148;) and China Railway
	Container Transport Co. Ltd. Dalang Processing Station (&#147;CRCT&#148;), the subsidiaries of CRC which operate freight service business. The purchase considerations for CREC and CRCT were approximately RMB102.3&nbsp;million and
	RMB79.9&nbsp;million, respectively. On the same&nbsp;day, control of the assets and operations of CREC and CRCT were transferred to us. The results of the operations of the above-mentioned entities have been included in our consolidated
	comprehensive income statement from November&nbsp;30, 2013 onwards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On May 29, 2014, we entered into an agreement with
	Guangzhou Railway (Group) Company Guangzhou Railway Economic Development Co., Ltd. to acquire certain assets and liabilities in relation to the freight service business. The total amount of assets were RMB161.7 million and total amount of
	liabilities were RMB39.3 million. The purchase price was approximately RMB122.4 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	18
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D172754D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On October 20, 2014, we entered into an agreement with Guangzhou Railway (Group) Guangshen
	Railway Enterprise Development Company to acquire approximately an additional 17.7% equity interest in Zengcheng Lihua Stock Company Limited (&#147;Zengcheng Lihua&#148;). The purchase price was approximately RMB &#052;&#046;&#055;
	million.&nbsp;Upon the completion of the acquisition, we held an aggregate of approximately 44.7% equity interest in Zengcheng Lihua.&nbsp;On February 12, 2015, we obtained control of Zengcheng Lihua and began to consolidate its financial statements
	from that date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Service Territory
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our rail lines traverse the Pearl River Delta and also run vertically through Guangdong Province, an area which benefited early from the PRC economic reform policies that began in the late
	1970s.&nbsp;Throughout the 1980s and early 1990s, the economy of the Pearl River Delta, fueled by foreign investments, grew rapidly.&nbsp;The Pearl River Delta is currently one of the most affluent and fastest growing areas in China.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of April 27, 2016, we had 48 stations situated on our rail lines, providing passenger and freight transportation services for cities,
	towns and ports situated along the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Shenzhen-Guangzhou-Pingshi
</FONT>
</FONT>
	corridors and Hong Kong Through Train passenger service, which we serve in conjunction with the MTR. We
	also provide railway operation services to other Chinese domestic railway companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Shenzhen-Guangzhou-Pingshi
</FONT>
</FONT>
	railroad is an integral component of the PRC national railway network, and provides nationwide access to passenger and freight traffic from southern China to other regions of
	mainland China as described below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Northbound
</I>
	.&nbsp;At Pingshi, our rail line connects with the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing-Guangzhou
</FONT>
	line, which is one of the major trunk lines linking southern China with Beijing and northern China.&nbsp;Another trunk line connecting northern and southern China, the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing-Hong
</FONT>
	Kong rail line, includes the section of our line from Dongguan to Shenzhen.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Southbound
</I>
	.&nbsp;Our line connects at Shenzhen with the rail line owned by the MTR that runs to Kowloon, Hong Kong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Westbound
</I>
	.&nbsp;Our line connects with the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Maoming
</FONT>
	rail line operated by
	Guangdong Sanmao Railway Company, a company in which GRGC holds a 49.1% equity interest, which runs through the western part of Guangdong Province, connecting with other rail lines that continue on into the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, which
	provides access to southwestern China. Our line also connects with Guangzhou-Foshan-Zhaoqing Intercity Railway, which commenced operation on March 30, 2016 and was jointly invested by Guangdong Provincial Railway Construction Investment Group Co.,
	Ltd. and the CRC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Eastbound
</I>
	.&nbsp;Our line connects with the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Meizhou-Shantou
</FONT>
</FONT>
	rail line and Xiamen-Shenzhen rail line. Guangzhou-Meizhou-Shantou rail line is operated by Guangmeishan Railway Company, a company jointly established by GRGC, the Guangdong
	Provincial Railway Company and other public investors.&nbsp;A section of this line forms, along with our Dongguan to Shenzhen segment, a part of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing-Hong
</FONT>
	Kong rail line, which terminates in Kowloon,
	Hong Kong. The section of Xiamen-Shenzhen rail line in Guangdong Province is owned by Xiamen-Shenzhen Railway (Guangdong) Company Limited, a subsidiary of GRGC. We provide the operational services to Xiamen-Shenzhen Railway (Guangdong) Company
	Limited. At Pinghu, our rail line connects with two local port lines: one of them, Pingnan Railway, principally serves three ports located in western Shenzhen&#151;Shekou, Chiwan and Mawan&#151;and the other, Pingyan Railway, serves Yantian port, an
	international
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	deep-water
</FONT>
	port located in eastern Shenzhen.&nbsp;At the Huangpu and Xiayuan stations in Guangzhou, our line connects with Huangpu port and Xinsha port.&nbsp;Our rail line also connects with
	certain industrial districts, commercial districts and the facilities of many of our customers through spur lines, which are rail lines running off the main line that are used and typically financed by a freight customer or a group of freight
	customers and maintained by us for a fee. We believe that the customers connected to these spur lines and customers with goods that must be shipped through these regional ports are likely to use our services on a long-term basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	19
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage23"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D172754D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Capital Expenditure
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our capital expenditure includes payments for acquisition of fixed assets and construction-in-progress, and prepayments for fixed assets, net of related payables.&nbsp;In 2013, 2014 and 2015, our total
	capital expenditure were RMB1,376.6 million, RMB999.6 million and RMB1,292.3 million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For more information
	concerning the Company&#146;s principal capital expenditure and divestitures currently in progress, including the distribution of these investments geographically and the method of financing, see &#147;ITEM&nbsp;5. OPERATING AND FINANCIAL REVIEW AND
	PROSPECTS - B. Liquidity and Capital Resources&#148; and &#147;ITEM&nbsp;5. OPERATING AND FINANCIAL REVIEW AND PROSPECTS - F. Tabular Disclosure of Contractual Obligations.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D172754D20F_HTM_TOC172754_13">
</A>
	B.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Business Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Business Operations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our principal businesses are railroad passenger, transportation, freight transportation, railway network usage and other
	transportation-related services, which collectively generated &#057;&#051;&#046;&#049;% of our total revenue in 2015. The remaining &#054;&#046;&#057;% of our total revenue in 2015 mainly consisted of on-board catering services, leasing, sales of
	materials and supplies, sale of goods and other businesses related to railway transportation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2015, affected by the
	unfavorable factors including the slowdown of the macro-economy, the competition in the railway passenger transportation market and a weak demand in the railway freight transportation market, our passenger and freight transportation business
	continued to decline, which resulted in weak growth in our total revenue.&nbsp;We responded with a series of measures to increase our revenue and reduce expenses. With the goal to increase our revenue, we have been exploring opportunities in the
	railway passenger and freight transportation markets by making arrangements to open three new pairs of cross-network EMU traveling between Guangzhou East and Chaozhou-Shantou, strengthening the sales capability of the Hunan-Guangdong southern
	express lines for freight transportation, while extending the scope of our railway operation services, and adding railway operating services for Ganzhou-Shaoguan Railway Company Limited, Guiyang-Guangzhou Railway Company Limited and
	Nanning-Guangzhou Railway Company Limited at the same time.&nbsp;At the same time, we enhanced our cost controls, which helped reduce our general and non-production expenses.&nbsp;As a result of those measures, we were able to record slight growth
	in the overall operating revenue with more substantial growth in operating profit and net profit year-on-year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2015, we
	achieved a passenger delivery volume of 85.4&nbsp;million persons, representing
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	a&nbsp;year-to-year
</FONT>
	decrease of 5.3%; a tonnage of freight of 48.4&nbsp;million tons, representing
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	a&nbsp;year-to-year
</FONT>
	decrease of 6.1%; generating operating revenues of RMB15,725&nbsp;million, representing
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	a&nbsp;year-to-year
</FONT>
	increase of 6.3%; consolidated profits
	attributable to equity holders of RMB1,071&nbsp;million, representing
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	a&nbsp;year-to-year
</FONT>
	increase of 61.8%; and basic earnings per share of RMB0.15.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	20
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Revenue per
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	passenger-kilometer
</FONT>
	is calculated by dividing total passenger transportation revenue by total
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	passenger-kilometers.
</FONT>
	Management believes that revenue per
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	passenger-kilometer
</FONT>
	is a useful measure for assessing the revenue levels of our passenger transportation business.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Revenue per ton is calculated by dividing total freight revenue by total freight tons.&nbsp;Management believes that revenue per ton is a useful measure for assessing
	the revenue levels of our freight transportation business.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Revenue per
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	ton-kilometer
</FONT>
	is calculated by dividing total freight revenue by total
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	ton-kilometers.&nbsp;Management
</FONT>
	believes that revenue per
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	ton-kilometer
</FONT>
	is a useful measure for assessing the revenue levels of our freight transportation business.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Passenger Transportation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Passenger transportation is our largest business segment, accounting for 44.5% of our total revenue and &#052;&#055;&#046;&#056;% of our railroad and related business revenue in 2015.&nbsp;Our passenger
	train services can be categorized as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	transportation business of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Shenzhen
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	inter-city
</FONT>
	express
	trains;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we operated a total of 239 pairs of passenger trains per&nbsp;day (each pair of trains meaning trains making one
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	round-trip
</FONT>
	between
	two points), representing an increase of 5.5&nbsp;pairs from 233.5&nbsp;pairs as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, of which:

	and Beijing West.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Long-distance
</FONT>
	trains also included domestic long-distance trains that are operated by other operators but originating or terminating on, or passing through, our railroad.

<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	(1)

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our revenue of long-distance passenger trains includes both the revenue from the passengers arriving at our railway stations and the revenue from the passengers
	departing from our railway stations. However, the number of our long-distance passengers only includes the passengers departing from our railway stations. As a result, we believe that the &#147;per passenger revenue&#148; cannot fairly reflect the
	financial status of our passenger transportation business.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Since 2014, we have separated Other Revenues from Passenger Transportation from Long-distance Trains to more accurately reflect the correlation between passenger
	revenue and volumes, and have re-categorized Revenue from Long-distance Trains for 2012 and 2013 to reflect this change.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Guangzhou
</I>
<I>
</I>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	-Shenzhen
</FONT>
	Trains
</I>
	.&nbsp;In 2015, our passenger transportation services on the trains between Guangzhou and Shenzhen accounted for
	&#051;&#049;&#046;&#056;% of our railroad passenger transportation revenue.&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we operated 105 pairs of intercity CRH passenger trains between Guangzhou and Shenzhen.&nbsp;Such CRH passenger trains are capable of
	running at a top speed of 200 kilometers per hour.&nbsp;The number of passengers traveling on our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Shenzhen
</FONT>
	trains decreased by &#048;&#046;&#056;&#057;% from 36.0&nbsp;million in 2014 to
	&#051;&#053;&#046;&#055; million in 2015.&nbsp;The revenue from our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Shenzhen
</FONT>
	trains increased by &#053;&#046;&#050;% from RMB2,115.1 million in 2014 to RMB2,224.0&nbsp;million in 2015. The decrease
	in passenger volume was primarily due to the increasing number of high-speed railways between the Pearl River-Delta Area and other major cities in China, which has greatly drawn away passengers from us.&nbsp;The increase in revenue of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Shenzhen
</FONT>
	trains was primarily due to the commencement of the service of three pairs of cross-network EMU trains between Guangzhou and Chaozhou-Shantou on February 1, 2015, and the revenue from such trains
	is accounted for in the revenue from Guangzhou-Shenzhen trains.
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	22
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D172754D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Hong Kong Through Trains
</I>
	.&nbsp;In 2015, our passenger transportation services on Hong
	Kong through trains accounted for &#055;&#046;&#051;% of our railroad passenger transportation revenue.&nbsp;We currently operate, jointly with the MTR, 13&nbsp;pairs of Hong Kong Through Trains (including 11&nbsp;pairs of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Canton-Kowloon
</FONT>
	Through Trains, 1 pair of Zhaoqing-Kowloon Through Trains and 1&nbsp;pair of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing/Shanghai-Kowloon
</FONT>
	Through Trains).&nbsp;We are responsible for the operation
	of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Beijing/Shanghai-Kowloon
</FONT>
	Through Trains and 8&nbsp;pairs of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Canton-Kowloon
</FONT>
	Through Trains while MTR is responsible for the operation of 3&nbsp;pairs of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Canton-Kowloon
</FONT>
	Through Trains. In addition, we also provide railway network usage services to MTR for the Hong Kong Through Trains it operates in the section between Shenzhen Station and Guangzhou East
	Station.
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Hong Kong Through Train services beyond Guangzhou to Foshan, Zhaoqing, Beijing and Shanghai are
	provided by GRGC and Shanghai Railway Bureau.&nbsp;Revenue from these Hong Kong Through Trains on the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Guangzhou-Hong
</FONT>
	Kong section is shared between MTR and us, in proportion to our track mileage for the Hong
	Kong Through Train services, with 81.2% accruing to us and 18.8% to MTR.
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
	In addition, we share all related costs with MTR at the same rate for the Hong Kong Through Train services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Most of the passengers taking our Hong Kong Through Trains are from Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan regions and foreign countries, and many are
	business travelers.&nbsp;As the prices for our Hong Kong Through Train services are higher than the prices we charge for our domestic train services, these Hong Kong Through Train services produce higher
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	per-passenger
</FONT>
	revenue than our other passenger train services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2015, the volume of
	passengers who traveled on the Hong Kong Through Trains decreased by &#050;&#046;&#054;% from 3.9&nbsp;million in 2014 to &#051;&#046;&#056; million in 2015.&nbsp;The revenue from Hong Kong Through Trains decreased by 3.1% from RMB526.9&nbsp;million
	in 2014 to RMB510.4 million in 2015.&nbsp;This decrease in passenger volume and revenue was mainly due to the &#147;Occupy Central&#148; movement in Hong Kong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Domestic Long
</I>
<I>
</I>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	-distance
</FONT>
	Trains
</I>
	. In 2015, our passenger transportation services on domestic long-distance trains accounted for 55.5% of our
	railroad passenger transportation revenue.&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we operated on a daily basis 121 pairs of long-distance trains on our rail lines to cities in Guangdong, Hunan, Hubei, Jiangxi, Anhui, Jiangsu, Liaoning, Shaanxi, Gansu,
	Fujian, Heilongjiang, Jilin, Zhejiang, Hebei, Henan, Sichuan, Yunnan, Hainan, Shanxi and Shandong provinces, Chongqing, Shanghai, Beijing and Tianjin municipalities and Guangxi Autonomous Region and Tibet Autonomous Region. In 2015, the number of
	passengers traveled on our long-distance trains was 45.9 million,&nbsp;representing a decrease of 8.6% from 50.2&nbsp;million in 2014. Our revenue from long-distance trains in 2015 was RMB3,883.6 million, compared to RMB3,782.5&nbsp;million in 2014.
	The decrease of the passenger volume of long-distance trains was primarily due to the increasing number of high-speed railways between the Pearl River- Delta Area and other major cities in China, which has greatly drawn away passengers from us. The
	increase in revenue of long-distance trains was primarily due to the commencement of the service of one pair of long-distance trains between Guangzhou and Ganzhou on September 30, 2014.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	23
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>

	Major Stations
</I>
	.&nbsp;The following are the major train stations owned and operated by
	us as of December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</FONT>

	&nbsp;

<TD>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:24PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	Station
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	Location
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Freight Transportation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Revenue from our freight transportation accounted for 11.2% of our total revenue and 12.0% of our railroad and related business revenue in 2015. Our principal market for freight is domestic medium and
	long-haul freight, originating and/or terminating outside the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Shenzhen-Guangzhou-Pingshi
</FONT>
</FONT>
	corridor.&nbsp;We are well equipped with various freight facilities and can
	efficiently transport full load cargo, single load cargo and containers.&nbsp;We have established business cooperation with ports, logistics bases and specialized building materials markets in our service region.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The majority of the freight we transport is high-volume, medium to long-distance freight received from and/or transferred to other rail
	lines.&nbsp;A portion of the freight we transport both originates and terminates in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Shenzhen-Guangzhou-Pingshi
</FONT>
</FONT>
	corridor.&nbsp;We classify our freight business into
	three categories:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	inbound freight, which is primarily freight unloaded at freight stations and spur lines connected to ports on our rail line or in Hong Kong;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	outbound freight, which is primarily freight bound for other regions in Mainland China as well as foreign countries loaded at our train stations and
	spur lines connected to ports on our rail line or in Hong Kong; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pass-through
</FONT>
	freight, which refers to freight that travels on our rail line, but which does not originate from
	or terminate at our rail line.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Revenue from freight transportation business in 2015 was RMB1,761.4 million,
	an decrease of 0.1% from RMB1,763.7 million in 2014.&nbsp;The total tonnage of freight we transported in 2015 was 48.4 million tons, representing a decrease of 6.1% from 51.6 million tons in 2014.&nbsp;The decrease in freight revenue and volume of
	freight transportation was mainly due to the slowing economy in China, the structural adjustment in the Pearl River Delta region and the heightened competition in the freight transportation market in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We serve a broad customer base and ship a wide range of goods in our freight transportation business.&nbsp;We are not dependent upon any
	particular customers or industries.&nbsp;We transport a broad range of goods, which can generally be classified as follows:&nbsp;metal ores, coal, containers, construction materials, steel, petroleum, and other goods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	24
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage28"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D172754D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The majority of our inbound freight consists of raw materials and essential production
	materials for manufacturing, industrial and construction activities, while the majority of our outbound freight consists of imported mineral ores as well as coal and goods produced or processed within our service territory, for customers throughout
	China and abroad.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Railway Network Usage and other Transportation-Related Services Business
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Revenue from our railway network usage and other transportation-related services accounted for 37.4% of our total revenue and 40.1% of our
	railroad and related business revenue in 2015. In 2015, our revenue from railway network usage and other transportation-related services was RMB5,874.7&nbsp;million, representing an increase of 16.8% from RMB5,031.2&nbsp;million in 2014.&nbsp;The
	increase in revenue from railway network usage and other transportation-related services was principally due to:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	an increase in the railway operation services we provided to railway companies we have been serving in the past, including but not limited to,
	Wuhan-Guangzhou Passenger Railway Line Co., Ltd., Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong Kong Express Rail Link Company Limited, Xiamen-Shenzhen Railway Company Limited and Ganzhou-Shaoguan Railway Company Limited.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the railway operating services we newly provided to Guiyang-Guangzhou Railway Company Limited and Nanning-Guangzhou Railway Company Limited.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
