<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c)&nbsp;state of the Company&#146;s share capital;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d)&nbsp;reports showing the aggregate par value, quantity, highest and lowest price paid in respect of each class of shares repurchased by the Company since
	the end of last accounting year and the aggregate amount paid by the Company for this purpose;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(e)&nbsp;minutes of shareholders&#146; general meetings;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(f)&nbsp;the latest audited financial reports and the directors&#146;, auditors&#146; and supervisors&#146; reports thereon;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(g)&nbsp;special resolutions of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(h)&nbsp;a copy
	of the latest annual financial report filed with the national taxation department or other authorities in charge;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;in the event of the
	termination or liquidation of the Company, to participate in the distribution of surplus assets of the Company in accordance with the number of shares held;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(7)&nbsp;other rights conferred by laws, administrative regulations and these articles of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 55 The ordinary shareholders of the Company shall assume the following obligations:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;to abide by these articles of association;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;to pay subscription monies according to the number of shares subscribed and the method of subscription;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;except as stipulated under laws and regulations, withdrawal shall not be made;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;other obligations imposed by laws, administrative regulations and these articles of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Shareholders are not liable to make any further contribution to the share capital other than as agreed by the subscriber of the relevant shares on
	subscription.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 17 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage206"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 56 In addition to the obligations imposed by laws and administrative regulations or required by the
	listing rules of the stock exchange on which shares of the Company are listed, a controlling shareholder shall not exercise his voting rights in respect of the following matters in a manner prejudicial to the interests of the shareholders as a whole
	or of some of the shareholders of the Company:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;to relieve a director or supervisor of his duty to act honestly in the best interests of the
	Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;to approve the expropriation by a director or supervisor (for his/her own benefit or for the benefit of another person), in any guise,
	of the Company&#146;s assets, including (without limitation) opportunities beneficial to the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;to approve the expropriation by a director
	or supervisor (for his/her own benefit or for the benefit of another person) of the individual rights of other shareholders including (without limitation) rights to distributions and voting rights save pursuant to a corporate restructuring submitted
	to the shareholders&#146; general meeting for approval in accordance with these articles of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the flows of operating capital between the
	controlling shareholder and other connected parties and the Company, appropriation of the Company&#146;s capital shall be stringently restricted. The controlling shareholder and other connected parties shall not request the Company to pay in advance
	salaries, benefits, insurance, advertisement and other fees for them. Also, they may not bear the costs and other expenses on behalf of one another.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	Company shall not directly or indirectly provide capital to the controlling shareholder and other connected parties for use in the following ways:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;to lend capital of the Company to the controlling shareholder and other connected parties for use whether at a consideration or at nil consideration;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;to extend entrusted loans to the connected parties through banks or non-bank financial institutions;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;to entrust the controlling shareholder and other connected parties to conduct investment activities;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;to issue a bill of acceptance without real transaction background for the controlling shareholder and other connected parties;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;to pay off liability for the controlling shareholder and other connected parties;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;other ways specified by China Securities Regulatory Commission.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 18 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage207"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 57 For the purpose of the foregoing Article, a &#147;controlling shareholder&#148; means a shareholder
	who holds 50&nbsp;per cent or more of the shares of the Company, or in the case of less than 50&nbsp;per cent, the voting rights represented by the shares held by whom are sufficient to exert a significant influence upon the resolutions of the
	general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 58 Subject to the compliance of relevant laws, regulations and rules, where the Company intends to issue preference shares, the
	rights and obligations of holders of such shares shall be resolved upon by the shareholders in general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 8:
	SHAREHOLDERS&#146; GENERAL MEETINGS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 59 The shareholders&#146; general meeting is the organ of authority of the Company and shall exercise its
	functions and powers in accordance with law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 60 The shareholders&#146; general meeting shall have the following functions and powers:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;to decide on the Company&#146;s operational policies and investment plans;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;to elect and replace directors and decide on matters relating to the remuneration of directors;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;to elect and replace the supervisors who are representatives of shareholders and decide on matters relating to the remuneration of supervisors;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;to examine and approve reports of the board of directors;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;to examine and approve reports of the supervisory committee;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;to examine and approve the Company&#146;s proposed annual preliminary and final financial budgets;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(7)&nbsp;to examine and approve the Company&#146;s profit distribution plans and plans for making up losses;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(8)&nbsp;to decide on increases or reductions in the Company&#146;s registered capital;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(9)&nbsp;to decide on matters such as merger, division, dissolution and liquidation of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(10)&nbsp;to decide on the issue of debentures by the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(11)&nbsp;to decide on the appointment, dismissal and disengagement of the accounting firm of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 19 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage208"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(12)&nbsp;to amend these articles of association;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(13)&nbsp;to consider motions raised by shareholders who represent 3&nbsp;per cent or more of the total shares of the Company carrying the right to vote;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(14)&nbsp;to consider and approve the proposals for the establishment of strategy, audit, nomination, remuneration, appraisal and other special committees of
	the board of directors of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(15)&nbsp;to decide on other matters which require resolutions of the shareholders in general meeting according to
	relevant laws, administrative regulations and provisions of these articles of association;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(16)&nbsp;to decide on matters which the board of directors
	may be delegated or authorized to deal with by the shareholders in general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 61 The Company shall not, without the prior approval of
	shareholders in general meeting, enter into any contract with any person other than a director, supervisor; general manager, deputy general manager or other senior administrative officer whereby the management and administration of the whole or any
	substantial part of the business of the Company is to be handed over to such person.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 62 Shareholders&#146; general meetings are divided into
	annual general meetings and extraordinary general meetings. Shareholders&#146; general meetings shall be convened by the board of directors. Annual general meetings shall be held once every year and within six (6)&nbsp;months from the end of the
	preceding accounting year. In the event that the Company is not able to convene the annual general meeting within the aforesaid prescribed period for any reasons, it shall report to the relevant stock exchanges to explain the reasons and make an
	announcement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under any of the following circumstances, the board of directors shall convene an extraordinary general meeting within two (2)&nbsp;months:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;when the number of directors is less than the number of directors required by the Company Law or two-thirds of the number of directors specified
	in these Articles of Association;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;when the unrecovered losses of the Company amount to one-third of the total amount of its paid in share
	capital;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;when the shareholder(s) holding 10&nbsp;per cent or more of the Company&#146;s outstanding shares carrying voting rights request(s) in
	writing the convening of an extraordinary general meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;when deemed necessary by the board of directors;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;when requested by the supervisory committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 20 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage209"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article&nbsp;63 A shareholders&#146; general meeting shall be convened by a written notice served by way of
	announcement or other means specified under these Articles of Association (if necessary) at least forty-five (45)&nbsp;days before the date of the meeting to notify all shareholders whose names are shown on the register of members of the matters to
	be considered and the date and venue of the meeting. A shareholder who intends to attend the shareholders&#146; general meeting shall deliver his written reply concerning the attendance of the meeting to the Company twenty (20)&nbsp;days before the
	date of the meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In order to assure the legality and validity of the shareholders&#146; general meeting, the Company will provide convenience for
	shareholders to attend shareholders&#146; general meetings through various means and approaches and will provide priority to modern information technology methods such as online voting platform.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 64 Shareholders who severally or jointly holding more than 3&nbsp;per cent of the Company&#146;s shares, are entitled to present a new proposal in
	written form to the board of directors at an annual general meeting. The Company shall include the matters in the proposal within the functions and powers of a shareholders&#146; general meeting in the agenda of the meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 65 The Company shall, based on the written replies received twenty (20)&nbsp;days before the date of the shareholders&#146; general meeting from the
	shareholders, calculate the number of voting shares represented by the shareholders who intend to attend the meeting. If the number of voting shares represented by the shareholders who intend to attend the meeting reaches one half or more of the
	Company&#146;s total voting shares, the Company may hold the meeting; if not, then the Company shall within five (5)&nbsp;days notify the shareholders again by public notice of the matters to be considered, the place and date for, the meeting. The
	Company may then hold the meeting after such publication of notice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An extraordinary general meeting shall not resolve any matter not stated in the
	notice of such meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article&nbsp;66 A notice of shareholders&#146; general meeting shall meet the following requirements:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;it shall be given by way of announcement or other means specified under these Articles of Association (if necessary);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;it shall specify the place, the date and time of the meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;it shall state the matters to be considered;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;it shall provide the shareholders with all such information and explanations as are necessary for the shareholders to make an informed decision on
	the proposals put before them. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, where a proposal is made to amalgamate the Company with another, to repurchase shares, to reorganize the share capital, or to restructure the Company in any other way,
	the terms of the proposed transaction must be provided in detail together with copies of the proposed agreement, if any, and the cause and effect of such proposal must be properly explained;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 21 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage210"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;if any director, supervisor, general manager, deputy general manager or other senior administrative
	officer has a material interests in matters to be considered, he shall disclose the nature and the extent of such interest; and if the matters to be considered have an effect on such director, supervisor, general manager, deputy general manager or
	other senior administrative officer in his capacity as shareholder in so far as it is different from the effect on the interests of the shareholders of the same class, such differences shall be specified;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;it shall contain the full text of any special resolution to be proposed for approval at the meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(7)&nbsp;it shall expressly specify in writing that all shareholders are entitled to attend the shareholders&#146; general meeting. The shareholders entitled
	to attend and vote at the meeting shall have the right to appoint one or more proxies to attend on his behalf and to vote thereat and the proxy or proxies need not be a shareholder;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(8)&nbsp;it shall specify the time and place for lodging proxy forms for the relevant meeting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(9) The voting time and voting procedures (if any) for online voting or other methods of voting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article&nbsp;67 Notice of shareholders&#146; general meeting shall be given to the shareholders (whether or not entitled to vote at the meeting) by way of
	public notice or served on them by delivery or prepaid airmail to their addresses as shown in the register of shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notice of shareholders&#146;
	general meeting to holders of domestic shares shall be published in one or more newspapers designated by securities regulatory authority under the State Council at least forty-five (45)&nbsp;days before the date of the meeting. After the publication
	of such notice, all holders of domestic shares shall be deemed to have received the notice of the relevant shareholders&#146; general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notice of
	shareholders&#146; general meeting to holders of overseas listed foreign-invested shares shall be published in the website of the Company (www.gsrc.com) at least forty-five (45)&nbsp;days before the date of the meeting. After the publication of such
	notice, all holders of overseas listed foreign-invested shares shall be deemed to have received the notice of the relevant shareholders&#146; general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 68 The accidental omission to give notice of a meeting to, or the failure to receive the notice of a meeting by, any person entitled to receive notice
	shall not invalidate the meeting and the resolutions made at that meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 69 Any shareholder who is entitled to attend and vote at a
	shareholders&#146; general meeting have the right to appoint one or more persons (whether being a shareholder or not) as his proxies to attend and vote at such meeting on his behalf. Such proxy or proxies may exercise the following rights pursuant
	to the authorization from that shareholder:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;the shareholder&#146;s right to speak at the shareholders&#146; general meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 22 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage211"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;the right to demand or join in demanding a poll;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;the right to vote by hand or on a poll, but a proxy of a shareholder who has appointed more than one proxy may only vote on a poll.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The board of directors, independent directors and shareholders that meet certain requirements may make a call to the shareholders for voting rights at the
	shareholders&#146; general meeting in accordance with relevant provisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Information shall be fully disclosed to persons whose voting rights are
	solicited. No consideration or other form of de facto consideration shall be involved in soliciting voting rights from shareholders. The Company shall not impose any limitation related to minimum shareholdings on soliciting voting rights.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 70 The instrument appointing a proxy shall be in writing under the hand of the appointer or his attorney duly authorized in writing, or if the
	appointer is a legal entity, either under seal or under the hand of a director or attorney duly authorized.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 71 The instrument appointing a voting
	proxy and, if such instrument is signed by a person under a power of attorney or other authority on behalf of the appointer, a notarially certified copy of that power of attorney or other authority shall be deposited at the address of the Company or
	at such other place as is specified for that purpose in the notice convening the meeting, not less than twenty-four (24)&nbsp;hours before the time for holding the meeting at which the proxy propose to vote or the time appointed for the passing of
	the resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the appointor is a legal person, its legal representative or such person as is authorized by resolution of its board of directors or
	other governing body may attend at any meeting of shareholders of the Company as a representative of the appointor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 72 Any form issued to a
	shareholder by the board of directors of the Company for use by him for appointing a proxy shall be such as to enable the shareholder, according to his free will, to instruct the proxy to vote in favour of or against the motions, such instructions
	being given in respect of each individual matter to be voted on at the meeting. Such a form shall contain a statement that in the absence of instructions by the shareholder the proxy may vote as he thinks fit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 73 A vote given in accordance with the terms of an instrument of proxy shall be valid notwithstanding the death or loss of capacity of the appointor
	or revocation of the proxy or of the authority under which the proxy was executed, or the transfer of the shares in respect of which the proxy is given, provided that no notice in writing of such death, incapacity, revocation or transfer as
	aforesaid shall have been received by the Company before the commencement of the meeting at which the proxy is used.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 23 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage212"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 74 A proxy who attends a shareholders&#146; general meeting on behalf of a shareholder shall present his
	identification document.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a shareholder who is a legal person appoints its legal representative to attend the meeting, the legal representative shall
	present his own identification document and a notarially certified copy of the resolution or letter of authorization of the board of directors or other governing body of the appointor appointing such legal representative.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 75 Resolutions of shareholders&#146; general meetings shall be divided into ordinary resolutions and special resolutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To adopt an ordinary resolution, votes representing more than one half of the voting rights represented by the shareholders (including proxies) present at the
	meeting must be exercised in favor of the resolution in order for it to be passed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To adopt a special resolution, votes representing more than two-thirds
	of the voting rights represented by the shareholders (including proxies) present at the meeting must be exercised in favor of the resolution in order for it to be passed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The shareholders (including proxies) present at the meeting shall expressly state&nbsp;their agreement with, objection to or abstention from every matter to
	be determined by voting, except for the securities registration and settlement institutions which, being the nominal holders of shares subject to Shanghai- Hong Kong Stock Connect, shall make declaration according to the intentions of actual
	holders. Any vote which is not completed, erroneously completed or illegible or uncast votes shall be counted as an abstention of voting rights by the voters and the voting results of the number of shares they hold shall be counted as
	&#147;abstain.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where any shareholder is required to abstain from voting on a particular resolution or restricted to vote only in favor of or
	against any particular resolution, any votes cast by or on behalf of such shareholder in contravention of such requirement or restriction shall not be counted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 76 When shareholders (including their proxies) vote at the shareholders&#146; general meeting, they shall exercise their voting rights according to
	the number of voting shares that they represent. Each share shall carry one voting right. Any share of the Company held by the Company shall not carry any voting right. However, when electing directors or supervisors, the number of voting rights
	each share carries shall be the same as the number of directors or supervisors to be elected. The voting rights of shareholders may be exercised collectively in favor of one or several of the directors or supervisors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	When substantial matters that affect small and medium investors&#146; interests are reviewed in the general meeting, the votes of small and medium investors
	shall be counted separately. Results from the separate counting shall be disclosed to the public in due course.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 77 At any general meeting of
	shareholders, a resolution shall be decided on a show of hands unless a poll is (before or after any vote by show of hands) demanded:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;by the
	chairman of the meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 24 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage213"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;by at least two shareholders entitled to vote present in person or by proxy;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;by one or more shareholders present in person or by proxy and individually or collectively representing 10&nbsp;per cent or more of all shares
	carrying the right to vote at the meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Unless a poll be so demanded, a declaration by the chairman that a resolution has on a show of hands been
	carried unanimously, and, an entry to that effect in the minutes of the meeting shall be conclusive evidence of the fact without proof of the number or proportion of the votes recorded in favour of or against such resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The demand for a poll may be withdrawn by the person who makes such demand.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 78 A poll demanded on the election of the chairman of the meeting, or on a question of adjournment of the meeting, shall be taken forthwith. A poll
	demanded on any other question shall be taken at such time as the chairman of the meeting directs, and any business other than that upon which a poll has been demanded may be proceeded with, pending the taking of the poll. The result of the poll
	shall be deemed to be a resolution of the meeting at which the poll was demanded.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 78(A) Before a resolution is put to vote at a
	shareholders&#146; general meeting, two (2)&nbsp;representatives of the shareholders shall be elected to participate in counting the votes as well as to act as scrutineer. If a shareholder has interest in the matter to be considered, such
	shareholder and its proxy shall not participate in the counting of the votes nor act as scrutineer.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	When proposals are being voted at a
	shareholders&#146; general meeting, lawyers, representatives of the shareholders and representatives of the supervisors shall be jointly responsible for the counting of votes and scrutinizing of the votes. The results of the voting shall be
	announced at the meeting and shall be recorded in the minutes of meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Shareholders or their proxies who vote via internet or in other methods are
	entitled to check their own voting results through the relevant voting system.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 79 On a poll taken at a meeting,&nbsp;only one of the voting
	methods, namely voting on-site, voting online or other voting methods, can be selected for the same voting right. In case of duplicate voting for the same voting right, only the first voting result is considered as valid.&nbsp;A shareholder
	(including proxy) entitled to two or more votes need not cast all his votes in the same way.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 80 In the case of an equality of votes, whether on a
	show of hands or on a poll, the chairman of the meeting at which the show of hands takes place or at which the poll is demanded shall be entitled to one additional vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 81 The following matters shall be resolved by an ordinary resolution at a shareholders&#146; general meeting:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;work reports of the board of directors and the supervisory committee;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;plans formulated by the board of directors for distribution of profits and for making up losses;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;removal of the members of the board of directors and members of the supervisory committee, their remuneration and method of payment;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;annual preliminary and final budgets, balance sheets and profit and loss statements and other financial statements of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)matters other than those required by the laws and administrative regulations or by these articles of association to be adopted by special resolutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 82 The following matters shall be resolved by a special resolution at a shareholders&#146; general meeting:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;the increase or reduction in share capital and the issue of shares of any class, warrants and other similar securities by the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 25 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage214"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;the issue of debentures by the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;the spin-off, merger, dissolution and liquidation of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;the amendments to these Articles of Association;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;the alternation of the form of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;the acquisition or sale of major assets or guarantees within one year exceeding 30&nbsp;per cent of the total assets of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(7)&nbsp;any other matters considered by the shareholders&#146; general meeting, by way of an ordinary resolution, to be of a nature which may have a material
	impact on the Company and would need to be adopted by a special resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 83 Where the shareholders&#146; general meeting is considering
	matters related to a connection transaction, a connected shareholder shall not participate in voting and the shares with voting rights which they represent shall not be counted in the total number of valid votes. Announcement on the resolutions
	passed at the shareholders&#146; general meeting shall adequately disclose the details of the unconnected shareholders&#146; votes. If the connected shareholders are unable to abstain from voting due to special reasons, they may vote according to
	the normal procedures after the Company has obtained consent of the competent authority. Detailed explanation shall be given in the announcement regarding the resolutions passed at the general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A connected transaction referred to in the preceding paragraph refers to an event whereby a transfer of resources or obligations takes place between connected
	parties, regardless of whether a consideration is paid, for instance:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;the sale or purchase of merchandise;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;the sale or purchase of assets other than merchandise;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;outside investment, including entrust finance and entrust loans, etc;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;provision of financial assistance;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;provision
	of guarantees, excluding counter guarantees;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;lease-in/lease-out of assets;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(7)&nbsp;assets and business management trust;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 26 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage215"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(8)&nbsp;giving or being given assets;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(9)&nbsp;credit and debt restructuring;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(10)&nbsp;signing of
	licence agreements;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(11)&nbsp;transfer or receipt of research and development projects;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(12)&nbsp;the provision or receipt of labour services;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(13)&nbsp;sale trust;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(14)&nbsp;joint investment by connected
	parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(15)&nbsp;other events whereby a transfer of resources or obligations takes place through agreement, or other transactions deemed by securities
	exchange institutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following transactions with connected parties may be exempted from resolution and disclosure as connected transactions without
	violating the regulations, rules or codes formulated and/or implemented from time to time by the regulatory authorities where its shares or securities are listed:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;one party subscribes in cash for the shares, corporate bonds and debentures, convertible bonds or other derivatives offered publicly by the other
	party;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;one party, as a member of a underwriting syndicate, underwrites the shares, corporate bonds and debentures, convertible bonds or other
	derivatives offered publicly by the other party;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;a connected party receives dividends, bonuses or remuneration in accordance with a resolution
	of shareholders&#146; general meeting of the other party;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;connected transactions arising from any party participating in public biddings or
	auctions, etc;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;other transactions deemed by securities exchange institute.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A connected shareholder shall voluntarily abstain from voting and surrender his voting rights in the shareholders&#146; general meeting. In the event that a
	connected shareholder does not voluntarily abstain from voting, the chairman of the meeting shall request the connected shareholder to abstain from voting. In case where the chairman needs to abstain from voting, the vice-chairman or other directors
	shall request the chairman and other connected shareholders to abstain from voting. Any shareholder who does not need to abstain from voting may request connected shareholders to abstain from voting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 27 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage216"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Should a shareholder being requested to abstain from voting or other shareholders object to the nature of the
	connected transaction and the disclosure of interest, abstention from voting and surrender of voting rights in the meeting arising therefrom, an extraordinary board meeting of the directors who do not need to abstain from voting may be sought to
	resolve the matter. Such resolution shall be final. Should the dissenter still have an objection, he may file a complaint to the agency of the Securities Regulatory Commission or seek to solve the case in other ways after the shareholders&#146;
	general meeting.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 84 Shareholders calling for an extraordinary general meeting or a class meeting shall follow the following procedures:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;Shareholder(s) severally or jointly holding for more than ninety (90)&nbsp;consecutive days an aggregate of 10&nbsp;per cent or more of the
	shares carrying the right to vote at the proposed meeting may sign one or more written request(s) requiring the board of directors to convene an extraordinary general meeting or a class meeting and stating the object of the meeting therein. The
	board of directors shall as soon as possible proceed to convene the extraordinary general meeting or a class meeting thereof after receiving such request.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The number of shares held by the above shareholders shall be calculated as at the date of such request, and evidence of holding the Company&#146;s shares for
	more than ninety (90)&nbsp;consecutive days shall be provided to the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;If the board of directors fails to issue a notice of such a
	meeting within thirty (30)&nbsp;days from the date of receipt of such request, the supervisory committee shall promptly convene an extraordinary general meeting or a class meeting thereof. If the supervisory committee fails to issue a notice
	convening such meeting within thirty (30)&nbsp;days, the shareholders making such request may themselves convene such a meeting by such procedures as similar as possible as that in which shareholders&#146; meetings are to be convened by the board of
	directors within four (4)&nbsp;months from the date of receipt of such request by the board of directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any expenses reasonably incurred by such
	shareholders as a result of convening any such meeting due to the failure of the board of directors in convening such meeting shall be repaid to such shareholders by the Company and any sum so repaid shall be offset against any sum owed by the
	Company to the directors in default.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 85 The Chairman of the board of directors shall convene and take the chair of every shareholders&#146;
	general meeting. If the Chairman is unable to attend the meeting for any reason, the vice-chairman of the board of directors shall convene and take the chair of the meeting. If both the Chairman and vice chairman of the board of directors are unable
	to attend the meeting, then a director of the Company shall be recommended by more than half of the members of the board to convene and take the chair of the meeting. If no chairman of the meeting has been so designated, shareholders present shall
	choose one person to be the chairman of the meeting. If for any reason, the shareholders shall fail to elect a chairman, then the shareholder (including proxy) present in person or by proxy and holding the largest number of shares carrying the right
	to vote thereat shall be the chairman of the meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 28 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage217"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 86 The conclusion of the on-site meeting shall not be earlier than the closing time of online voting or
	other methods.&nbsp;The chairman of the meeting shall be responsible for the determination of whether a resolution is passed. His decision, which is final and conclusive, shall be announced at the meeting and recorded in the minutes of meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Before the formal announcement of the voting result, the related parties including companies, vote counters, scrutineers, major shareholders and network
	service providers at the meeting or participating in online voting or other methods of voting, shall bear the duty of confidentiality of the voting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 87 If the chairman of the meeting has any doubt as to the result of a resolution put to the vote of the meeting, he may have the votes counted. If the
	chairman of the meeting fails to have the votes counted, any shareholder who is present in person or by proxy and who objects to the result announced by the chairman of the meeting may demand that the votes be counted immediately after the
	declaration of the result, the chairman of the meeting shall have the votes counted immediately.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 88 If the votes are counted at a
	shareholders&#146; general meeting, the result of counting of votes shall be recorded in the minutes of the meeting and signed by directors present at the meeting. The minutes of the shareholders&#146; general meeting shall record the following
	matters:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;the number of shares carrying the right to vote attending the shareholders&#146; general meeting and its ratio to the total number of
	shares of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;the date and venue of the meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;the name of the chairman of the meeting and the agenda;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;the key points of each speaker on each matter for consideration;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;the voting result of each resolution;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;details of the queries and suggestions of shareholders and the responses or explanations of the board of directors and supervisory committee;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(7)&nbsp;other contents that should be recorded in the minute book as believed by the shareholders&#146; general meeting and required by these Articles of
	Association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The minutes, the signature book of shareholders attending the meeting, the proxy forms&nbsp;and valid information of voting through online
	and other methods&nbsp;shall be kept at the address of the Company&nbsp;for no less than 10 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 29 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage218"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 89 Copies of the minutes of proceedings of any shareholders&#146; general meeting shall, during business
	hours of the Company, be open for inspection by any shareholder without charge. If a shareholder demands from the Company a copy of such minutes, the Company shall send a copy of such minutes to him within seven (7)&nbsp;days after having received
	reasonable charges.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 9: SPECIAL PROCEDURES FOR VOTING BY A CLASS OF SHAREHOLDERS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 90 Those shareholders who hold different types of shares are different classes of shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Apart from the holders of other classes of shares, the holders of the Domestic-Invested Shares and holders of Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares shall be
	deemed to be shareholders of different classes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A class of shareholders shall, in accordance with laws, administrative regulations and these articles of
	association, enjoy rights and bear obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 91 Rights conferred on any class of shareholders in the capacity of shareholders (&#147;class
	rights&#148;) may not be varied or abrogated unless approved by a special resolution of shareholders in general meeting and by holders of shares of that class at a separate meeting conducted in accordance with Articles 89 to 93.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 92 The following circumstances shall be deemed to be variation or abrogation of the class rights of a class:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;to increase or decrease the number of shares of such class, or increase or decrease the number of shares of a class having voting or equity rights or
	other privileges equal or superior to those of the shares of such class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;to effect an exchange of all or part of the shares of such class into
	shares of another class or to effect an exchange or create a right of exchange of all or part of the shares of another class into the shares of such class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;to remove or reduce rights to accrued dividends or rights to cumulative dividends attached to shares of such class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;to reduce or remove a dividend preference or a liquidation preference attached to shares of such class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;to add, remove or reduce conversion privileges, options, voting rights, transfer or pre-emptive rights, or rights to acquire securities of the
	Company attached to shares of such class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 30 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage219"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;to remove or reduce rights to receive payment payable by the Company in particular currencies attached
	to shares of such class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(7)&nbsp;to create a new class of shares having voting or equity right or other privileges equal or superior to those of the
	shares of such class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(8)&nbsp;to restrict the transfer or ownership of the shares of such class or add to such restriction;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(9)&nbsp;to allot and issue rights to subscribe for, or convert into, shares in the Company of such class or another class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(10)&nbsp;to increase the rights and privileges of shares of another class;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(11)&nbsp;to restructure the Company where the proposed restructuring will result in different classes of shareholders bearing a disproportionate burden of
	such proposed restructuring;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(12)&nbsp;to vary or abrogate the provisions of this Chapter.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 93 Shareholders of the affected class, whether or not otherwise having the right to vote at shareholders&#146; general meetings, shall nevertheless
	have the right to vote at class meetings in respect of matters concerning sub-paragraphs (2)&nbsp;to (8), (11)&nbsp;and (12)&nbsp;of Article&nbsp;88, but interested shareholder(s) shall not be entitled to vote at class meetings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The meaning of &#147;interested shareholder(s)&#148; as mentioned in the preceding paragraph is:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;in the case of a repurchase of shares by offers to all shareholders or public dealing on a stock exchange under Article&nbsp;30, a &#147;controlling
	shareholder&#148; within the meaning of Article&nbsp;53;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;in the case of a repurchase of share by an off-market contract under Article&nbsp;30, a
	holder of the shares to which the proposed contract relates;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;in the case of a restructuring of the Company, a shareholder within a class who
	bears less than a proportionate obligation imposed on that class under the proposed restructuring or who has an interest different from the interest of shareholders of that class.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 94 Resolutions of a class meeting of shareholders shall be passed only by votes representing more than two-thirds of the voting rights of shareholders
	of that class represented at the relevant meeting in accordance with Article&nbsp;89.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where any shareholder is, under the Rules&nbsp;Governing the
	Listing of Securities on The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited, required to abstain from voting on a particular resolution in a class meeting or restricted to voting only in favour of or against any particular resolution in a class meeting, any
	votes cast by or on behalf of such shareholder in contravention of such requirement or restriction shall not be counted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 31 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage220"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article&nbsp;95 A written notice of a class meeting shall be given by way of public notice or other means
	specified under these articles of association (if necessary) at least forty-five (45)&nbsp;days before the date of the class meeting to notify all shareholders whose names are shown in the share register of the class of the matters to be considered,
	the date and venue of the class meeting. A shareholder who intends to attend the class meeting shall deliver his written reply concerning his attendance at the class meeting to the Company twenty (20)&nbsp;days before the date of the class meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the number of shares carrying voting rights at the meeting represented by the shareholders who intend to attend the class meeting reaches more than
	one half of the voting shares at the class meeting, the Company may hold the class meeting; if not, the Company shall within five (5)&nbsp;days notify the shareholders again by public notice of the matters to be considered, the date and the place
	for the class meeting. The Company may then hold the class meeting after such publication of notice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 96 Notice of class meetings need only be
	served on shareholders entitled to vote thereat.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Meetings of any class of shareholders shall be conducted in a manner as similar as possible to that of
	general meetings of shareholders. The provisions of these articles of association relating to the manner to conduct any shareholders&#146; general meeting shall apply to any meeting of a class of shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 97 The special procedures for voting at a class of shareholders shall not apply to the following circumstances:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;where the Company issues, upon the approval by a special resolution of its shareholders in general meeting, either separately or concurrently once
	every twelve months, not more than 20&nbsp;per cent of each of its outstanding Domestic-Invested Shares and Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;where the Company&#146;s plan to issue Domestic-Invested Shares and Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares at the time of its establishment is
	carried out within fifteen (15)&nbsp;months from the date of approval of the Securities Committee of the State Council.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 10:
	BOARD OF DIRECTORS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 98 The Company shall establish a board of directors. The board shall consist of 9 directors. The board shall have one
	Chairman.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 32 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage221"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 99 Directors shall be elected at the shareholders&#146; general meeting and serve a term of 3 years. A
	director may serve consecutive terms if re-elected upon the expiration of his term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The written notice of an intention to nominate a candidate of
	director and that of a willingness to accept the nomination by the candidate shall be delivered no earlier than the day after the dispatch of the notice of the meeting for election of the relevant director and end no later than 7 days prior to the
	date of such meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Chairman of the board shall be elected and removed by the approval of more than half of all the directors of the board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Chairman of the board shall serve a term of 3&nbsp;years and may serve consecutive terms if re-elected upon the expiration of his term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subject to compliance with relevant laws and regulations, any director may be removed by ordinary resolution before the expiration of his term of office (but
	without prejudice to any claim for damages under any contract).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The directors shall not be required to hold shares of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 100 The directors of the Company shall include independent directors and at least one-third of the board members shall be independent directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An independent director is a director who does not act in other capacities in the Company other than as a director, and who does not have any relationship
	with the Company or its substantial shareholders which may affect the director in making independent and objective judgment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;The board of
	directors, supervisory committee of the Company or shareholders, individually or jointly, holding 1&nbsp;per cent or more of the issued shares of the Company may nominate a candidate as independent director. Independent directors shall be elected at
	the shareholders&#146; general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Independent directors shall serve a term of 3&nbsp;years. A director may serve consecutive terms if re-elected
	upon the expiration of his term. However, an independent director shall not consecutively hold the office for more than six years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;The board of
	directors may propose to the shareholders&#146; general meeting to remove any independent director who is absent from the board meetings for three consecutive times. Except where a person shall not act as a director as stipulated in the Company Law,
	an independent director shall not be removed before expiration of office without reason. In the event of early removal from office, the Company shall disclose the same as a special disclosure matter. Should the independent director being removed
	from office consider the reason of removal to be improper, a public statement may be made.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 33 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage222"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;An independent director may resign before the expiration of his term. The independent director shall
	submit a written resignation to the board of directors, and state any matter that is related to his resignation or which he considers it necessary that the attention of the shareholders and creditors of the Company should be drawn to. Should the
	resignation of the independent director cause the ratio of independent directors in the board of directors of the Company to fall below one-third, the resignation of the independent director shall become effective after the vacancy is filled by the
	succeeding independent director.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;An independent director shall have the following special duties:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. a connected transaction of which the total consideration accounts for more than 5&nbsp;per cent of the latest audited net asset value of the Company shall
	be approved by the independent directors before submission to the board of the directors for discussion;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. to propose to the board of directors any
	engagement or removal of accountants;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. to propose to the board of directors the convening of an extraordinary general meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. to propose the convening of a board meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	E. to engage
	external auditors or consultants independently;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	F. should a matter proposed for discussion at a shareholders&#146; general meeting by the board require
	independent financial report by an independent financial adviser, the independent financial adviser shall be engaged by the independent directors;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	G. to
	make a call for voting rights to the shareholders before the shareholders&#146; general meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	H. to make independent opinions on significant events of
	the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To exercise the above duties, independent directors shall obtain approval of more than half of all independent directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 101 To ensure that the independent directors can effectively perform their duties, the Company shall provide to the independent director with the
	necessary working conditions as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;The Company shall ensure that the independent directors enjoy equal rights to information as other
	directors. In respect of any significant matter subject to board decision, the Company shall give prior notice to the independent directors within the prescribed time and provide them with adequate information at the same time. Should the
	independent directors consider the information to be inadequate, they may request for supplementary information. In the case where 2 or more independent directors consider the information to be inadequate or the grounds to be unclear, they may
	propose jointly in writing to postpone the board meeting or delay the discussion of the relevant matters by the board of the directors. Such proposal shall be accepted by the board of directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 34 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage223"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;The Company shall provide the independent directors with the necessary working conditions for the
	discharge of their duties. The secretary to the board of directors of the Company shall actively assist the independent directors with their discharge of duties, including briefing on the situation and provision of materials, etc..
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;When the independent directors perform their duties, the relevant staff of the Company shall actively coordinate with them, and shall not refuse,
	hinder or conceal, and shall not interfere with their independence in discharging their duties. The Company shall make disclosure where the proposals of independent directors are not accepted or their duties cannot be performed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;The fees required for the engagement of intermediaries and discharge of other duties by the independent directors shall be borne by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;The Company shall offer appropriate allowances to the independent directors. The budget for the level of allowances shall be formulated by the board
	of directors and approved at a shareholders&#146; general meeting. Apart from the above allowances, the independent directors shall not obtain other additional or undisclosed benefits from the Company and its substantial shareholders or an
	institution in which the independent directors have interests and its staff.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;The Company may establish a compulsory liability insurance system
	of the independent directors according to its needs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 102 An independent director shall fulfill the following requirements:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;possesses the qualifications as an independent director of a listed company in accordance with the laws, regulations and other related requirements;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;satisfies the criteria of independence as stipulated in laws, administrative regulations and regulatory documents;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;has basic knowledge of the operations of a listed company, and is familiar with the relevant laws, administrative regulations, regulations and rules;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;possesses more than 5&nbsp;years&#146; working experience in practicing law, finance or possess other experience necessary for discharging the
	duties as an independent director;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;other requirements as specified in these articles of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 35 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage224"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following persons shall not act as an independent director:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;an employee of the Company or its subsidiaries and his/her direct relatives and main social relations (direct relatives include spouse, parents and
	children while main social relations include siblings, parents-in-law, sons/daughters-in-law, spouses of siblings, siblings of spouse);
</P>
