	(6) The Company shall disclose the information related to implementation of the cash dividend policy and other relevant circumstances in its periodical
	reports in accordance with relevant provisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 165 The profit distribution decision-making procedure and mechanism shall be as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1) Formulation of and amendment to the profit distribution policy and specific profit distribution plan shall be proposed to the shareholders&#146; general
	meeting by the board of directors. In the process of formulating the profit distribution policy and profit distribution plan, the board of directors shall discuss with independent directors, taking full account of a continuous, stable and scientific
	return to all shareholders of the Company and a sustainable development of the Company. When reviewing the profit distribution policy and specific profit distribution plan at the shareholders&#146; general meeting, the Company shall communicate and
	exchange opinions with shareholders, especially minority shareholders in a proactive manner and through various channels, fully consider the advices and appeals from minority shareholders and respond timely to the issues concerned by them.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2) Formulation of and amendment to the policy of distribution of profits and specific profit distribution plan shall be passed by more than 50% the directors
	and passed by more than 50% independent directors. The independent directors shall give independent views on the formulation of and amendment to the profit distribution policy and specific profit distribution plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3) Formulation of and amendment to the policy of distribution of profits and specific profit distribution plan shall be proposed to the shareholders&#146;
	general meeting. Formulation of and amendment to the policy of distribution of profits shall be passed by more than two-thirds of the voting rights held by the shareholders present at the shareholders&#146; general meeting. Formulation of and
	amendment to the specific profit distribution plan shall be passed by more than 50% voting rights held by the shareholders present at the shareholders&#146; general meeting. When it is necessary for the Company to adjust its profit distribution
	policy, based on the circumstances of production and operation, investment plans and needs of long-term development, when it is necessary to adjust the policy for profit distribution in cash, the adjustment shall be passed by more than two-thirds of
	the voting rights held by the shareholders present at the shareholders&#146; general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 55 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage244"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4) Where the Company make profit in a year but fails to propose to distribute profit in cash for such year, the
	board of directors shall explain the reasons and the purposes and application plan of the funds not distributed by way of cash dividend in details in annual report. The independent directors shall provide their independent views thereon.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 166 Dividends or other payments declared by the Company to be payable to holders of Domestic-Invested Shares shall be declared and calculated in
	Renminbi, and paid in Renminbi; and those payable to holders of Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares shall be declared and calculated in Renminbi, and paid in the local currency at the place where such Foreign-Invested Shares are listed (if there
	is more than one place of listing, then the principal place of listing as determined by the board of directors).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Foreign currency required by the Company
	for payment of dividends or other sums to holders of Foreign-Invested Shares shall be handled in accordance with the relevant foreign exchange control regulations of the State. If there is no applicable regulation, the applicable exchange rate shall
	be the average closing rate for the relevant foreign currency announced by the Peoples&#146; Bank of China for the week prior to the announcement of the payment of dividend or other sums.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 167 The Company shall, in accordance with the People&#146;s Republic of China&#146;s tax law, withhold and make payments on behalf of shareholders in
	respect of their tax payable on their dividends income.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 168 The Company shall appoint on behalf of the holders of the Overseas-Listed
	Foreign-Invested shares receiving agents to receive on behalf of such shareholders dividends declared and all other monies owed by the Company in respect of their shares. The receiving agents appointed by the Company shall comply with the relevant
	requirements of the law of the place and relevant regulations of the stock exchange where the Company&#146;s shares are listed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The receiving agents
	appointed on behalf of holders of H Shares shall be a company registered as a trust company under the Trustee Ordinance of Hong Kong.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 16: APPOINTMENT OF ACCOUNTING FIRM
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 169 The Company shall engage an independent accounting firm which is qualified under the relevant regulations of the State to audit the Company&#146;s
	annual financial report and review the Company&#146;s other financial reports.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The first accounting firm of the Company may be engaged by the inaugural
	meeting of the Company before the first annual general meeting of shareholders and the accounting firm so appointed shall hold office until the conclusion of the first annual general meeting of shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the inaugural meeting fails to exercise its powers under the preceding paragraph, those powers shall be exercised by the board of directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 170 The accounting firm engaged by the Company shall hold office from the conclusion of the annual general meeting of shareholders at which it is
	engaged until the conclusion of the next annual general meeting of shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 56 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage245"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 171 The accounting firm appointed by the Company shall have the following rights:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;A right of access at any time to the books and records and vouchers of the Company, and shall be entitled to require from the directors, general
	manager, deputy general managers and other senior administrative officers of the Company any relevant information and explanation;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;A right to
	require the Company to take all reasonable steps to obtain from its subsidiaries such information and explanation as are necessary for the purposes of discharging its duties;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;A right to attend shareholders&#146; general meetings and to receive all notices of, and other communications relating to, any shareholders&#146;
	general meeting which any shareholder is entitled to receive, and to speak at any shareholders&#146; general meeting in relation to matters concerning its role as the Company&#146;s accounting firm.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 172 Before the convening of the shareholders&#146; general meeting, the board of directors may fill any casual vacancy in the office of an accounting
	firm, but while any such vacancy continues, the surviving or continuing firms, if any, may act.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 173 The shareholders in general meeting may by
	ordinary resolution remove an accounting firm before the expiration of its term of office, notwithstanding the stipulations in the contract between the Company and the firm, but without prejudice to the firm&#146;s right to claim, if any, for
	damages in respect of such removal.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 174 The remuneration of an accounting firm or the manner in which such firm is to be remunerated shall be
	determined by the shareholders in general meeting. The remuneration of an accounting firms appointed by the board of directors shall be determined by the board of directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 175 The Company&#146;s appointment of, removal of and non reappointment of an accounting firm shall be resolved upon by shareholders in general
	meeting. The resolution of the shareholders&#146; general meeting shall be filed with the securities governing authority of the State Council.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where it
	is proposed that any resolution be passed at a shareholders&#146; general meeting concerning the appointment of an accounting firm which is not an incumbent firm to fill a casual vacancy in the office of the accounting firm; re appointment of a
	retiring accounting firm which was appointed by the board of directors of the Company to fill a casual vacancy; or removal of the accounting firm before the expiration of its term of office, the following provisions shall be complied with:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;A copy of the proposal shall be sent before notice of meeting is given to the shareholders to the firm proposed to be engaged or proposing to leave
	its post or which has left its post in the relevant fiscal year (leaving includes leaving by removal, resignation and retirement).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 57 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage246"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;If the firm leaving its post makes representations in writing and requests the Company to notify the
	shareholders of such representations, the Company shall, unless the representations are received too late:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(i)&nbsp;in any notice of the resolution given
	to shareholders, state the fact of the representations having been made; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(ii)&nbsp;attach a copy of the representations to the notice and deliver it
	to the shareholders in the manner stipulated in these articles of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;If the firm&#146;s representations are not sent in accordance
	with the preceding sub-paragraph (2), the relevant firm may (in addition to its right to be heard) require that the representations be read out at the shareholders&#146; general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;An accounting firm which is leaving its post shall be entitled to attend:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(i)&nbsp;the shareholders&#146; general meeting at which its term of office would otherwise have expired;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(ii)&nbsp;the shareholders&#146; general meeting held for the purpose of filling the vacancy caused by its removal; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(iii)&nbsp;the shareholders&#146; general meeting convened due to its resignation;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	and to receive all notices of, and other communications relating to, any such meetings, and to speak at any such meeting in relation to matters concerning its
	role as the former accounting firm of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 176 Prior to the removal or the non-renewal of the appointment of the accounting firm, notice
	of such removal or non-renewal shall be given to the accounting firm and such firm shall be entitled to make representation at the shareholders&#146; general meeting. Where the accounting firm proposes resigning its post, it shall make clear to the
	shareholders&#146; general meeting whether there has been any impropriety on the part of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An accounting firm may resign its office by
	depositing at the Company&#146;s legal residence a written resignation notice which shall become effective on the date of such deposit or on such later date as may be stipulated in such notice and such notice shall include the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;a statement to the effect that there are no circumstances connected with its resignation which it considers should be accounted for to the
	shareholders or creditors of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;a statement of any such circumstances.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 58 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage247"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where a written notice is deposited as provided for in the preceding subparagraph, the Company shall within
	fourteen (14)&nbsp;days thereof send a copy of the notice to the relevant governing authority. If the notice contains a statement under the preceding subparagraph (2), copies of such statement shall be placed at the Company for shareholders&#146;
	inspection. The Company shall also send a copy of such statement by prepaid mail to every holder of Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares who is entitled to receive the issuer&#146;s financial status report at the address registered in the
	register of shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where the accounting firm&#146;s notice of resignation contains a statement of any circumstances which shall be accounted for
	to the shareholders or creditors of the Company, it may require the board of directors to convene a shareholders&#146; interim general meeting for the purpose of receiving its explanation of the circumstances connected with its resignation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 17: INSURANCE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 177 The
	effecting, types of coverage, the insured amounts and periods of the Company&#146;s insurance shall be decided at a meeting of the board of directors based on the circumstances of the Company and the practices of similar industries in other
	countries and the practice and legal requirements in China.
</P>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_INFORMATION>
<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 18: LABOUR AND PERSONNEL MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 178 The Company shall, in accordance with the relevant provisions of the Labour Law of the People&#146;s Republic of China and other relevant laws or
	regulations of the State, formulate its labour and personnel management systems which shall be appropriate to its particular circumstances.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 19: TRADE UNION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 179 The
	employees of the Company may establish a trade union to carry out trade union activities and protect the legal interests of the employees in accordance with the Trade Union Law of the People&#146;s Republic of China. The Company shall provide the
	trade union with all necessary conditions for its activities and allocate funds to the trade union in accordance with the Trade Union Law of the People&#146;s Republic of China. Such fund shall be used by the trade union of the Company in accordance
	with the &#147;Measures for the Management of Trade Union Funds&#148; formulated by the All China Federation of Trade Unions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The representatives of the
	trade union of the Company may, on behalf of the employees of the Company, enter into any collective agreement with the Company in relation to issues including wages, working hours, benefits, insurance, and labor safety and health in accordance with
	the law. The Company shall seek advice from the trade union before making any material decision on its reform and operation and formulation of regulations and shall convene trade union representatives&#146; meeting or by other means to collect
	opinions and suggestions of the employees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 59 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage248"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the Constitution and other relevant laws, the Company exercises democratic management through
	employees&#146; representatives meeting or other means.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 20: MERGER AND DIVISION OF THE COMPANY
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 180 In the event of the merger or division of the Company, a plan shall be presented by the Company&#146;s board of directors and shall be approved in
	accordance with the procedures stipulated in these articles of association and then the relevant examining and approving formalities shall be processed as required by law. A shareholder who objects to the plan of merger or division shall have the
	right to demand the Company or the shareholders who consent to the plan of merger or division to acquire that dissenting shareholder&#146;s shareholding at a fair price.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The contents of the resolution for merger or division of the Company shall be made into special documents for shareholders&#146; inspection. Such special
	documents shall be sent by mail to holders of Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 181 The merger of the Company may be in the form of either
	acquisition or establishment of a new company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event of a merger of the Company, parties to the merger shall enter into a merger agreement and
	prepare a balance sheet and a list of assets. The Company shall notify its creditors within ten (10)&nbsp;days from the date of the Company&#146;s resolution to merge and shall publish a public notice in a newspaper within thirty (30)&nbsp;days from
	the date of the Company&#146;s resolution to merge. A creditor has the right within thirty (30)&nbsp;days upon receipt of such notice from the Company or, if no notice is received, within forty-five (45)&nbsp;days from the date of the first public
	notice, to demand the Company to settle the debts owed to it or to provide a corresponding guarantee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon completion of the merger of the Company, debts
	and indebtedness of parties to the merger shall be assumed by the company surviving the merger or the company newly established for such purpose.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE
	182 In the event of a spin-off of the Company, its assets shall be split accordingly.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event of a spin-off of the Company, parties to such spin-off
	shall enter into a spin-off agreement and prepare a balance sheet and a list of assets. The Company shall notify its creditors within ten (10)&nbsp;days from the date of the Company&#146;s resolution in respect of such spin-off and shall publish a
	public notice in a newspaper within thirty (30)&nbsp;days from the date of such resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 60 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage249"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Unless a written agreement has been entered into by the Company and its creditors in relation to the repayment of
	debts before the spin-off, companies surviving such spin- off shall jointly assume the indebtedness of the Company which has been incurred before such spin-off.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 183 Where there is a change in any of the registered items of the Company as result of its merger or division, the Company shall carry out procedures
	necessary for changing its registered items with the companies registration authority in accordance with the law. In case of dissolution, the Company shall cancel its registration in accordance with the law. When a new company is established, its
	establishment shall be registered in accordance with the law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 21: DISSOLUTION AND LIQUIDATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 184 The Company shall be dissolved upon the occurrence of any of the following events:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;a resolution for dissolution is passed by the shareholders at a general meeting;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;dissolution is necessary for the purpose of a merger or spin-off of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;revocation of business licence of the Company or the Company is ordered to close down or is dissolved in accordance with the law;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;dissolution by the People&#146;s Court according to Article&nbsp;183 of the Company Law;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;the Company is unable to repay its due debts in full and is declared bankrupt in accordance with the law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 185 Where the Company is dissolved under sub-paragraphs (1), (3)&nbsp;and (4)&nbsp;of the preceding Article, a liquidation committee shall be set up
	within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days from the event of dissolution of the Company to commence the liquidation. The composition of the liquidation committee of the Company shall be determined by the directors or an ordinary resolution of shareholders&#146;
	general meeting. If no liquidation committee is set up within the prescribed period to commence the liquidation, creditors may apply to the People&#146;s Court to designate relevant persons to form a liquidation committee in order to carry out the
	liquidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where the Company is dissolved under sub-paragraph (5)&nbsp;of the preceding Article, the People&#146;s Court shall in accordance with the
	provisions of the relevant laws organize and establish a liquidation committee to carry out the liquidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 61 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage250"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 186 Where the board of directors proposes to liquidate the Company due to causes other than where the
	Company has declared that it is insolvent, the board shall include a statement in its notice of the shareholders&#146; general meeting to consider the proposal to the effect that, after making full inquiry into the status of the Company, the board
	of directors is of the opinion that the Company will be able to pay off its debts within twelve (12)&nbsp;months from the commencement of the liquidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Except where the Company has declared that it is insolvent, the liquidation group shall be appointed or dismissed by ordinary resolution of shareholders at a
	general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon the passing of the resolution by the shareholders at a general meeting for the liquidation of the Company, all functions and powers
	of the board of directors shall forthwith cease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The liquidation group shall act in accordance with the instructions of the shareholders&#146; general
	meeting to make a report at least once every year to the shareholders&#146; general meeting on its receipts and payments, the business of the Company and the progress of the liquidation; and to present a final report to the shareholders&#146;
	general meeting on completion of the liquidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 187 The liquidation committee shall within ten (10)&nbsp;days from its establishment send
	notice to creditors, and within sixty (60)&nbsp;days from its establishment publish a public notice in a newspaper. A creditor shall within thirty (30)&nbsp;days upon receipt of such notice, or if no notice is received, within forty-five
	(45)&nbsp;days from the date of the first public notice, declare its creditor&#146;s rights to the liquidation committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	When declaring creditor&#146;s
	rights, the creditor shall give details of the creditor&#146;s rights together with the evidence thereof. The liquidation committee shall register creditors&#146; rights and no settlement can be made to the creditors by the liquidation committee
	during the period for declaration of creditors&#146; rights.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 188 During the liquidation period, the liquidation group shall exercise the
	following functions and powers:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;to sort out the Company&#146;s assets and prepare a balance sheet and an inventory of assets respectively;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;to send notices to creditors or notify them by public notice;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;to handle any relevant unfinished business matters of the Company relating to the liquidation;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;to pay off all outstanding taxes;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5)&nbsp;to settle
	claims and debts;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 62 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage251"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6)&nbsp;to dispose of the assets remaining after the Company&#146;s debts have been repaid;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(7)&nbsp;to represent the Company in any civil litigation proceedings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 189 After having sort out the Company&#146;s assets and prepared the balance sheet and an inventory of assets, the liquidation group shall formulate a
	liquidation plan and present it to a shareholders&#146; general meeting or to the relevant governing authority for confirmation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the extent that the
	Company&#146;s assets are sufficient to pay off its debts, they shall be used to pay all liquidation expenses, wages of staff and workers, labour insurance fees and outstanding taxes, and the Company&#146;s debts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The assets of the Company remaining after its debts have been repaid in accordance with the provisions of the preceding paragraph shall be distributed to its
	shareholders according to the class and proportion of their shareholdings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During the liquidation period, the Company shall not commence any new
	operational activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 190 If after putting the Company&#146;s assets in order and preparing a balance sheet and an inventory of assets in
	connection with the liquidation of the Company resulting from dissolution, the liquidation group discovers that the Company&#146;s assets are insufficient to repay the Company&#146;s debts in full, the liquidation group shall immediately apply to
	the People&#146;s Court for a declaration of insolvency.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	After a Company is declared insolvent by a ruling of the People&#146;s Court, the liquidation
	group shall turn over liquidation matters to the People&#146;s Court.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 191 Following the completion of liquidation, the liquidation group shall
	present a report on liquidation and prepare a statement of the receipts and payments during the period of liquidation and financial books and records which shall be audited by Chinese registered accountant and submitted to the shareholders&#146;
	general meeting or the relevant governing authority for confirmation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The liquidation group shall also within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after such
	confirmation, submit the documents referred to in the preceding paragraph to the companies registration authority and apply for cancellation of registration of the Company, and publish a public notice relating to the termination of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 22: PROCEDURES FOR AMENDMENT OF THE COMPANY&#146;S
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	ARTICLES OF ASSOCIATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 192 The
	Company may amend its articles of association in accordance with the requirements of law, administrative regulation and its articles of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 63 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage252"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 193 For the amendment of the Company&#146;s articles of association, the following procedures shall be
	followed:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;the board of directors shall, in accordance with provisions of these articles of association, adopt a resolution to propose the
	shareholders&#146; general meeting to amend the Company&#146;s articles of association, and formulate the draft amendments to the articles of association;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;notice of the draft amendments to these articles of association referred to in the preceding sub-paragraph shall be sent to the Company&#146;s
	shareholders, and a shareholders&#146; general meeting shall be convened to vote on the contents of the amendments;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;subject to the compliance of
	the relevant regulations of these articles of association and the Mandatory Provisions, a special resolution for approval of the draft amendments to these articles of association shall be passed by shareholders at a general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 194 The amendments to the Company&#146;s articles of association involving the contents of the Mandatory Provisions shall become effective upon
	approvals by the Securities Committee of the State Council and the companies approving department authorized by the State Council. If there is any change relating to the registered particulars of the Company, application shall be made for
	registration of the changes in accordance with law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 23: SETTLEMENT OF DISPUTES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 195 The Company shall act according to the following principles to settle disputes:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1)&nbsp;Whenever any disputes or claims arising between: holders of the Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares and the Company; holders of the
	Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares and the Company&#146;s directors, supervisors, general manager, deputy general managers or other senior administrative officers; or holders of the Overseas-Listed Foreign-Invested Shares and holders of
	Domestic-Invested Shares, based on these articles of association or any rights or obligations conferred or imposed by the Company Law or any other relevant laws and administrative regulations concerning the affairs of the Company, such disputes or
	claims shall be referred by the relevant parties to arbitration.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where a dispute or claim of rights referred to in the preceding paragraph is referred to
	arbitration, the entire claim or dispute must be referred to arbitration, and all persons who have a cause of action based on the same facts giving rise to the dispute or claim or whose participation is necessary for the resolution of such dispute
	or claim, shall abide by the arbitration provided that such person is the Company or the Company&#146;s shareholder, director, supervisor, general manager, deputy general manager or other senior administrative officer. Disputes in relation to the
	definition of shareholders and disputes in relation to the shareholders&#146; register need not be resolved by arbitration.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 64 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage253"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2)&nbsp;A claimant may elect arbitration at either the China International Economic and Trade Arbitration
	Commission in accordance with its Rules or the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre in accordance with its Securities Arbitration Rules. Once a claimant refers a dispute or claim to arbitration, the other party must submit to the arbitral body
	elected by the claimant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a claimant elects arbitration at Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre, any party to the dispute or claim may apply for
	a hearing to take place in Shenzhen in accordance with the Securities Arbitration Rules of the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3)&nbsp;If
	any disputes or claims of rights are settled by way of arbitration in accordance with sub-paragraph (1)&nbsp;of this Article, the laws of the People&#146;s Republic of China shall apply, save as otherwise provided in laws and administrative
	regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4)&nbsp;The award of an arbitration body shall be final and conclusive and binding on all parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CHAPTER 24: SUPPLEMENTARY
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article&nbsp;196 Notice of the Company (including notice of meetings, corporate communication or other written materials given to shareholders) may be given
	in the following manner: (1)&nbsp;by way of public notice; (2)&nbsp;personal delivery; (3)&nbsp;pre-paid post; (4)&nbsp;other means required under laws and regulations or listing rules of the place of listing or otherwise permitted by a supervisory
	authority.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any reference in these articles of association to the publication of public notices in a newspaper shall be interpreted as requiring
	publication in such newspaper as designated or required in accordance with relevant laws, administrative regulations or rules. In respect of the way by which corporate communication is required to be provided or given to holders of overseas listed
	foreign-invested shares under the Listing Rules of Hong Kong, such corporate communication may be provided or given to holders of overseas listed foreign-invested shares through the website of the Company (www.gsrc.com) or other electronic means
	subject to laws and regulations and listing rules of the place of listing and these articles of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 65 -
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage254"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The corporate communication refers to any document provided or to be provided to any holder of securities of the
	Company for reference or further action, including but not limited to (1)&nbsp;reports of the board of directors, annual accounts, auditor&#146;s reports and summary of financial reports (if relevant) of the Company; (2)&nbsp;interim reports and
	summary of interim reports (if relevant); (3)&nbsp;notice of the meetings; (4)&nbsp;listing documents; (5)&nbsp;circulars; (6)&nbsp;proxy forms (as defined in the listing rules of the stock exchange located in the place where shares of the Company
	are listed).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 197 In these articles of association, the meaning of an accounting firm is the same as that of &#147;auditors&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ARTICLE 198 The right to interpret these articles of association shall reside in the board of directors of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	- 66 -
</P>
</EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_1>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	EXHIBIT 7.1
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Statement Explaining How Certain Ratios Were Calculated in the Annual Report
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The operating expenses ratio of Guangshen Railway Company Limited, or the Company, is the ratio of its total railway operating expenses in 2015 (in the
	amount of RMB12,878.8 million, compared to RMB12,729.8&nbsp;million in 2014) to its railroad and related business revenue in 2015 (in the amount of RMB14,633.7&nbsp;million, compared to RMB13,783.2&nbsp;million in 2014).
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_7>

</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	CERTIFICATION OF CO-PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	I, Wu Yong, co-principal executive officer of Guangshen Railway Company Limited (&#147;Guangshen&#148;), certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of Guangshen;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in
	light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	3.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial
	condition, results of operations and cash flows of Guangshen as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	4.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Guangshen&#146;s other certifying officers and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
	13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for Guangshen and have:
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
	information relating to Guangshen, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide
	reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	evaluated the effectiveness of Guangshen&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
	disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(d)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	disclosed in this report any change in Guangshen&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has
	materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, Guangshen&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	5.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Guangshen&#146;s other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to Guangshen&#146;s
	auditors and the audit committee of Guangshen&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely
	affect Guangshen&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in Guangshen&#146;s internal control over financial
	reporting.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely
	affect Guangshen&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in Guangshen&#146;s internal control over financial
	reporting.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

	Railway Company Limited (&#147;Guangshen&#148;), certify that:

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

	light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

	condition, results of operations and cash flows of Guangshen as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

	13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for Guangshen and have:

	information relating to Guangshen, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</TD>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2. the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of
	the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Date: April&nbsp;27, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
